website_summaries.verdict: Everything you need in a reasonably priced double umbrella stroller plus a few extras that make this a top pick.
pros: It's lightweight and easy to push
Has mesh pockets and a cup holder for storage
Easy to fold and folds down small
cons: Canopies don't offer much sun protection

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Used this at Disney and it was helped a lot! Even my 8 year old sat in it with no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Danae

customer_reviews.title: But it is very light weight and very easy to push
customer_reviews.text: Yes it met my expectations , however the handles are a little low for me and I am 5'7". The one back wheel is a little wobbly. But it is very light weight and very easy to push. I have a 37lb 4 yr old and a 1 1/2 yr old and they fit wonderfully together
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use for my two year old and ten month old on a trip to Disney. I wanted something affordable and that is easy to tote around. I think that this is just that. It folds up pretty small for a double stroller so I think it will be pretty easy when traveling on the Disney busses. The sunshades are a little small but it's not really a big deal for me. It is really easy to maneuver. The only issue is the height of the handles. It's a little low, I'm 5'2 and it's perfect height for me but I can see how this would be a problem for a taller person.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality material , compact design and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Best Purchase EVER. That's probably an exaggeration but you cannot beat the price and convenience of this stroller. We purchased matching double stroller-carseat sets and fancy joggers (each for hundreds) when our twins were newborns and they're both collecting dust. The other strollers are collecting dust, not the kids... Thought I ought to clarify. This stroller folds up to nearly nothing! Instead of filling the trunk with a few hundred dollars of the stroller, we can cram hundreds of groceries. We have owned this for 13 months and the wheels and strap fasteners are still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Compact and light but don't leave child unattended in this stroller.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: compact, fits almost anywhere, it is light, and takes up small space in the vehicle. Nice storage on the stroller and it seems well balanced while loaded. Cons: can not push it one handed, the wheels aren't exactly level and one side wobbles lightly above the ground while others are flat. HUGE FLAW: child can easily stand out of the stroller seat due to the harness coming from the cloth seat and not from a place on the frame, this is not a securely harnessed stroller at all. I can picture it tipping forward over onto children if both were standing up.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Evers

customer_reviews.title: Wheels Stick
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to LOVE this stroller but it’s just OK. This is what I have beef with: 1) straps are a pain to adjust 2) the wheels aren’t smooth, they stick when pushing and making turns. I’m always having to check if brakes are on! 3) the canopies are useless for shade. I’d rather have them gone. 4) there’s really no reclining even if they say there is 5) impossible to push/maneuver w one hand What I like: 1) wont care if it gets lost 2) small footprint for going on trips, riding planes, buses, etc. 3) convenient if your child doesn’t arch back/try to get out
customer_reviews.author: Giographix

customer_reviews.title: Makes life and travel SO much easier
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have 1.5-year-old and a 3.5-year-old daughters, and this thing is absolutely PERFECT. We had struggled on walks and when traveling with two wonky-wheeled umbrella strollers for over a year now and have no clue how we missed out on this amazing double umbrella for so long. We used this for the first time when traveling via airport this past weekend and it made our lives unbelievably easy. We are doing a Disney cruise in November, and this thing has turned a daunting adventure into one that we will be able to enjoy without the usual hassle. 100% recommended. I would have paid twice as much for this if I’d known how great it is.
customer_reviews.author: T. Prizer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t recline and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: We got this today after reading reviews and questions. It does fold up easy and compact but it doesn’t recline hardly at all so if you are wanting a child to be able to nap in it I wouldn’t try this one. It also only holds 35 lbs per seat. I should have seen this in the description but I missed it and read the question and answers and went by that. Don’t make my mistake. My boys are under 30 lbs each and it just feels flimsy. I bought it wishing it had a basket and better sun shades but willing to do without. With everything else that we don’t like about it, it’s going back.
customer_reviews.author: The McKenzies

customer_reviews.title: Handles very low
customer_reviews.text: It is cute and my twinslove it ! BUT... The picture of the lime stroller shows alonger handle.. as if you can extend it. I did read the reviews before so I wasn't that surprised but I think you should remove that pictures bc it's misleading tall ppl like me.. I'm 5'10"! I'm taking the stroller to a welder friend who can extend the handles. So over all it's nice but you should be careful what you choose to believe
customer_reviews.author: Katia SkolTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's an ok stroller
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good stroller! The only downside to it is the sun shades are useless. They don't come down far enough to actually block and sun out so if we walk during the day the babies have the sun in their eyes constantly. I feel like they are more decorative than anything. The seats are also a little shallow. My petite 2 year old fits ok but my chunky 8 month old kind of looks like he's half on the seat lol Other than that, it maneuvers well easy to push.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Bauer

customer_reviews.title: This double stroller was perfect for our disney trip
customer_reviews.text: This double stroller was perfect for our disney trip! we were looking for something cheap and easily transportable knowing that we would have at least 2 tired and sleepy kids on our trip. This worked out perfectly.It allowed them to recline slightly as well. There was no pocket underneath but diaper bags were fine on the back of the stroller as long as at least one chile was in it otherwise it would tip over. When kids weren't riding in it we just threw the diaper bag in the actual seat.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money—only lasted 4 days
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a week of travel to basketball camps. I used it 4 days for about 4 hours each day. Day 1 the locks on the wheels broke. Day 2 the foam on the handles cracked and split. Day 3 the seam behind one side’s headspace split. Day 4 the latch to lock it when folded up broke. This was with very mild use—rolling from a parking lot into a smooth gym floor for 3 of the 4 days with the final day’s use on sidewalks. I purchased it because I needed something smaller than a standard double stroller to fit in my trunk, but it turned out to be a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: LBMH

customer_reviews.title: Great "cheap" stroller
customer_reviews.text: I have taken this stroller all over the place with my two littles. I have a 3 1/2 year old and a 6 month old. They both fit perfectly. I have to say if your child is very small, the straps probably won't be tight enough. My daughter can sit up on her own so it seems fine for her, but if your child can't, you may need to wait to use this as the arm straps do not tighten enough for very small children. I can push this through a regular door which is perfect because I even took into the hospital to visit family. All in all I absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Sica

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this. I wanted something lightweight and easy to maneuver. Pros- lightweight, saves space, nets on the back Cons- wheels seem cheap and glide or get stuck whenever i’m at a grocery store One of the bars to close always gets stuck and sometimes I can’t close it Harness doesn’t go tight enough to keep little ones arms in securely, he always manages to get his arms out and starts grabbing the wheel which is super annoying. Overall, just okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for vacation with small and big kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our trip to Australia from CT with a 6 & 3 yr old and a 9 mo th old. We were there for a month. I needed something that would easily fold to fit ina car and to be able to bring on public transportation. I also needed something that would fit all of the kids! This stroller is amazing!!!! We easily fit whichever 2 wanted to ride in the stroller and would either wear the baby or one or both of the kids would walk. It rides easily over different terrain. It even goes ok on sand if you pull it backwards.
customer_reviews.author: AimeeD

customer_reviews.title: The best thing about it is that it's super light weight ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat this double umbrella stroller. We took this on a three week trip to Japan and it held up well enough that we brought it home for future travels. The best thing about it is that it's super light weight and folds up into a nice small size. The seatbelts and wheels seem to be holding up pretty well. The one downfall which I've read on other reviews is that the shade part is really narrow so it doesn't really provide any shade. Overall, this is a really great umbrella stroller that I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: great 2nd stroller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was going to be traveling by plane with a 1.5 yr old and 3yr old and I did not want to bring our expensive stroller to the airport and have it checked in. (Made that mistake with 1st baby and they broke it). This was perfect! So light, easy to fold, smallish (it is still a double stroller). I wish the canopy was a little larger, but then again it may not be so light and small.... Overall I am very happy with this purchase for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Louis

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Double
customer_reviews.text: I pretty much exclusively bought this to use for a Disney World trip, since it costs as much as it would have been to rent a double stroller. It sure is compact and lightweight! But I'm 5'7 and the handles are a little short, I find myself kicking the wheels too. My 3.5 y/o does not really fit in the straps and she's by no means big for her age. If you are looking for a full time double you light want to see what else is out there but if you're looking for a lightweight/compact travel stroller this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: RaiseNoFool

customer_reviews.title: Used it in Morocco and Spain
customer_reviews.text: It help up over 2.5 weeks of intense travel. We're still using it 8 months later just fine. I went to Madrid and 5 cities in Morocco with my wife and two kids. Up city hills and dirt path mountains and airports. It held up. We had another dual carriage that was twice as heavy, and I could never imagine going on vacation with that. This made going international with two kids very possible.
customer_reviews.author: kinggambit

customer_reviews.title: The brakes on both sides broke in less than a month.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to carry my girls in and out of school and church everyday. We have used it less than a month and both brakes broke. They are plastic and all notches broke/bent so they no longer work and I can't take a hand off the stroller now to get my girls out and put them in the car. The stroller is lightweight and very easy to fold and unfold; however, it defeats the purposes we need it for if the brakes do not work. We are returning it for a refund and to buy a more durable umbrella stroller.
customer_reviews.author: tiffany

customer_reviews.title: So easy to open and close! Much lighter than previous.
customer_reviews.text: I had a much bigger heavy duty Greco stroller that I found at a garage sale that I’ve been using for the last 6 months. I knew this stroller would be perfect the minute I lifted it into the house. It’s so much lighter and can fit in my trunk (Ford Edge) without any torn muscles or aching backs. I have a 6m old 30” tall 20 lbs and a 2y/o 38”tall 23 lbs in the photo. It does a very clean 360, not bumpy or heavy when being strolled. I am 5’1 and the handles are perfect for me. My husband is 6’1 and has to hunch a little to push this stroller. He says it doesn’t bother him.
customer_reviews.author: LAAhart

customer_reviews.title: You cannot go wrong with this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this double stroller as much for me (grandma) as for my twin grandsons, age 16 months. They have the high-tech, very elaborate stroller, which I find impractical for trips to the park or a walk when I am babysitting. This stroller is perfect, not only for me, but also for my 6'1" son and much shorter daughter-in-law. I specifically asked my son if it was comfortable for him to push. It is lightweight, easy to maneuver up curbs, turns easily, and my son had it out of the box and ready to go in minutes. I highly recommend this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Frozenaddict

customer_reviews.title: Good for traveling
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty compact. I have a 3yrs old who is tall and a 16months who is also tall but this fits ok. I already have a kolcraft double stroller that I LOVE but it be too big for traveling which is why this will be used as our travel stroller. What I like about this stroller is that I can choose to put the cup holder on the right or the center. I was also able to clip my own small bag onto the bars behind the attached bags for extra storage. I've yet to use it yet but I cant wait to try!
customer_reviews.author: YX

customer_reviews.title: It really does fit through doors!
customer_reviews.text: The Delta Children's LX Side x Side Tandem is stronger and sturdier than most umbrella strollers and it is a good value at the price. It really shines because it fits through most doors and folds with reasonable compactness given that it is a double stroller. We used it around town and as a "travel" stroller so we could get around airports knowing it would survive being stowed with the other strollers and come out for use on the other side. It did the job well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Strong but Low and Small
customer_reviews.text: I had this returned mainly because it didn't fit my 4 year old well. The stroller itself is very strong, and it looks like a great stroller for you get kids, however I would consider these issues: - it's low, so if you are over 6" tall, this is not for you - recline doesn't recline enough, it doesn't lay even close to flat - umbrella is too small, doesn't provide enough shade - no place to put a diaper bag, which is a big con - no tray for kids However, the good stuff: - fold and unfolds easily - light weight - seems durable I still think its a great buy for younger kids
customer_reviews.author: LoLo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect !!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a up and coming Disney trip and for the money it’s well worth it . Assembly was SUPER easy , just had to pop front wheels on and it’s ready to go . Tested out with both my 15 month old and 4 years old and it rides very smooth , and turns with ease. Collapses easily and Compact for a double . Overall very pleased and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: very weak product !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very fragile stroller we got this product in the end of Jan this year and we got 2 broken rear wheels and can't be fixed we waist money 'll never shop again this brand today the customer service told me it can't be fixed only front wheel. So the only thing I can do is trash it very sad. We got another one from another brand much better and strong. The customer service did a good job contact me about my case and had send me a full refund check. We do appreciate you guys customer service. Update 10/22/2019
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughters ( aged 2.5 and 3.5) who visited for the summer Positives: Did not take too much space in trunk of car Easy to assemble and operate Fairly light Negatives: Sometimes the wheels get locked while rolling. Relatively easy for the girls to figure out that by attempting to stand while in the stroller stops the rolling Overall, I’m happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: La gal

customer_reviews.title: A solid, basic double stroller
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good stroller for walking on sidewalks, roads, and smooth surfaces. It can handle gravel ok, but has a lot of resistance on surfaces and rougher than that. Honestly, it's still very good for what it is. I have gotten a lot of use out of it so far. It has a really nice amount of storage for the size of stroller that it is too, so we're able to take snacks, water bottles, and any other little things we need without dragging the whole diaper bag with us. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: C Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 6 & 7 yr old at Disney!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this & had it shipped directly to our Disney resort. I worried that my daughter's chronic illness would spoil her Disney vacation but this stroller worked great & helped her to keep going all week long. This was light, easy to assemble & cheap enough to leave behind when our vacation was over. Total our 2 kids weigh almost 100 lbs & the stroller worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: KMG

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller for a reasonable price!
customer_reviews.text: Used this nonstop on a recent trip to Hawaii and it was perfect! Lightweight, folds easily to a compact size, drives better than my inline double stroller, fits through normal doors. Super easy to take through the airport and gate check. Sure it could use a bit more shade and sometimes the front wheel would stick out when turning and hit the door getting into an elevator but it exceeded my expectations for such an affordable double stroller.
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Poor brake design, will malfunction almost immediately impacting safety
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this stroller to carry our two daughters, 2 and 1 years old. The brakes stopped working almost immediately within days of using it. We returned it and received a replacement, only to have the brakes on the replacement stroller STOP WORKING AGAIN! The brakes are made out of cheap plastic, which almost guarantees it will break! Poor design of safety feature. Profits over safety anyone?
customer_reviews.author: Julio Guigni

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for this twin momma.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best double stroller. It’s compact enough to fit in a Toyota Prius. The seat declines so my babies can sleep easily in the stroller. There are two large mesh bags on the back that are extremely durable. I have the traditional double stroller as well and always opt to use this one. This stroller is also one of the least expensive ones on the market. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarasbananas

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love.
customer_reviews.text: Originally I had the dual graco stroller that hooks in the graco car seats. That one was SUPER heavy and I struggled with it at the airport. THIS stroller right here is perfect. Lightweight, has a cup holder. The only part you have to assemble are the front wheels which easily snap in and out if you want. It has a little caddy bag in the back of each seat to put diapers, bottles etc. my children are 1 and 2 years old. I think this one will be able to use it at least until they’re 3 and 4 yeas old.
customer_reviews.author: Roni

customer_reviews.title: Happy strolling
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this purchase. I easily fold and unfold the twin stroller to transport my toddler grandsons. It’s light weight, easy in and out buckles for these two busy, wiggley boys. I store my keys and cell phone in the cup holder. The storage space is adequate for a diaper change, baby wipes, and small water bottles. Overall, I am satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paz

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for what it is and the price...
customer_reviews.text: This has replaced all our other strollers. We basically just use this stroller now for our 2 boys, age 2 & 3. For the price, I was surprised that it some extra features like a cup holder, reclining seats, and larger durable wheels. It is a much smoother ride than cheaper umbrella strollers, where the wheels would get caught in a bump or crack in the sidewalk. I'm still giving it 5 stars even though it has some flaws, but the 5 stars is for what the product does and the low price.
customer_reviews.author: True

customer_reviews.title: I wish I’d seen this 3 strollers ago...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a lifesaver. It’s not the sturdiest for my two rough and wild kids but it’s worth every penny. It pushes like a dream, much easier and lighter than my sit n stand (which I’ll now get rid of)... Pros: Very lightweight Brakes are easy to flip Pushes/turns well Easy to close Easy access baskets Cup holder Very compact Cons: Not for tall people Small baskets Cup holder occasionally tips over Fits through doorways but can be tricky Small shade/hood
customer_reviews.author: Bairdsley

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a double stroller that was easy to travel with and this stroller exceeded my expectations. It folds fairly easily (I could do it with one hand while holding a baby). It folds very compactly and even fit through the x ray machine at the airport. It was easy to maneuver (I mean it’s no jogger but does the trick) -even up and down city hills. The storage was accessible and enough for snacks and diapers and a light coat. I was very pleased with this purchase! My four year old and one year old both enjoyed it and it made traveling a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Fluitt

customer_reviews.title: Best Double Stroller Ever
customer_reviews.text: After owning a bulky twin stroller we purchased this one and could not be happier. It's lightweight, easy to use, and easy to store. My boys are about 20 pounds each and fit fine and it looks like we will get a lot more use out of this. One suggestion for improvement is to increase the height of the handles. I am 5'10" and have to reach down a little for the handles.
customer_reviews.author: Xtian

customer_reviews.title: Very Lightweight, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This stroller was a great purchase for our family. Our twin girls love the stroller so far. They haven't directly told me, but their feet kicking and ease to fall asleep speaks for them. It's very lightweight and compact. My wife is able to lift it into the truck with no problems. The compact size while folded is great, as we're able to fit it in our vehicle with all 3 rows up. This is not possible with other strollers we have. I'd definitely recommend this to others. As others have said, the only con to this stroller is the size of the sunshade. It's not very useful to block the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Kendall P.

customer_reviews.title: This stroller is your best bang for the buck if you have two kids ...
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is your best bang for the buck if you have two kids and need something light weight and simple to push around. It does get a little awkward if you only have one child in there but it still easy to push. It does get a little awkward if you only have one child in there but still easy to push. I bought clip on cupholders to put near the kids that have been working fantastic and an extended sunvisor, as the ones that it comes with are about as useful as Rosie O'donell's personal trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay D.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with canopy!
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality for the price, but I wouldn't recommend for a lot of walking. After a few strolls we noticed the wheels were already pretty eaten up. Biggest letdown is the canopy, it's fine for my 2.5 year old who can wear sunglasses, but it provides absolutely no shade for my 9 month old who still pulls sunglasses off. Majorly disappointed with that and will not use it for outdoor activities. Happy with the storage and how light it is.
customer_reviews.author: Billy McGrail

customer_reviews.title: Double Child transportation
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box it is easy to assemble, the front wheels have little "shocks" in them to help with bumps. VERY maneuverable and easy to push and turn. The tube frame construction appears to be solid and secure. Would not recommend for intense offroading. 5 point harness provides adjustable for baby to 4T. Cute children are not included with stroller. These two are 3.5 years old and 14 months old. Toddler is 41 inches tall with 21 inch legs(waist to floor) and baby is 30 inches tall with 15 inch legs(waist to floor). We plan to use this stroller for running through airport Home Alone style. If it collapses I will edit my review.
customer_reviews.author: Ispend2much$here

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok for the price. What could be better is taller handles as it feels constructed for a shorter person to push. The sun shade is very small and doesn’t help with hardly any protection & isnt moveable much far as more downward to cover their face. It’s cheap & works but definitely needs improving.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Reitan

customer_reviews.title: Short but functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to go for walks through the neighborhood. It’s pretty difficult to adjust the lean of the seats. Also, it is very short. Thankfully i am only 5’3 so it works for me, but my sister who is 8 inches taller is very uncomfortable pushing the stroller. I also wish it had larger storage compartments. Otherwise great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Smart buy for big families
customer_reviews.text: Ok I have 5 kids and drive a minivan, so having room for a big bulky stroller did not seem feesible. I bought this wondering if I would regret it since we just had a newborn. All those other moms were sporting expensive strollers with the infants riding along in their carseat carriers. My two toddlers road in the stroller and I wore the baby in a baby carrier until my baby could hold his head up. Now he (5 months) rides around in the stroller and the oldest toddler walks beside. I love this stroller. It folds up easily and doesnt take up much room in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to fold and light. I brought for a vacation cruise and the maneuvering was horrible. The minute I took it out the box to open the stroller was the worst. I opened this ALL CHEAP metal stroller with my foot (barefoot) stupid me and it slit (gushing blood) my foot open. I am sure I needed stitches but had a plane to catch. My foot was in pain for half my trip and a bleed for the entire day. I threw it in the garbage when I got home. In
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stroller I have owned! I have gone through four different strollers to find exactly what I was looking for and the Delta is it. I have spent hundreds and hundreds of dollars on strollers, including the Bob. Nothing compares to the ease of use, lightweight design, and style of the Delta side by side stroller. It’s the first stroller my babies actually enjoyed sitting in. Folds quickly and light as a feather so that a small woman can pick it up and put it in the back of her car. Compact too so fits in the back of my small SUV.
customer_reviews.author: DrDonna

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: With a one year old and two year old, I have already gone through a few strollers and prams, this by far is my favorite! Easy to fold, doesnt take up much space, is really sturdy and has storage!
customer_reviews.author: Momma Eja 8189

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The wheels with great but the seats don't have a lot of support for the little ones backs. It does have a small carry net in the back but you can't carry much. The sun shade with the umbrella is really not nearly enough. However I do feel that I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Surprised
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stroller for my special needs daughter for an international flight. I was scared about the weight limit. She’s 45lbs, my other child 45 lbs to and to my surprise they both fit... they are 6&7 but short. It’s definitely going to be a one and done stroller for us, but if you have smaller kids that you want to grow into it, I’d definitely recommend !!
customer_reviews.author: brittney

customer_reviews.title: This is a Winner!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter who cares for two little boys, 6 months old. She said it isn't heavy, fits in the rear foot well (with all the other baby stuff they need for every trip) of her pickup truck, and sets up easily. The "Littles" are comfy and happy in their side by side seats. She's only had the Delta Side by Side umbrella stroller a couple months, so we can't speak for "durability." So far it's a winner in every way.
customer_reviews.author: StoryLady

customer_reviews.title: Good for airport use, not everyday user friendly
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use at the airport, and it was great there. After a few more uses, I started to dislike it. The wheels get stuck constantly making it hard to maneuver and push. Also, the “brakes” broke off on both sides, so now we don’t have brakes on it.
customer_reviews.author: Korissa Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller and compact when not in use
customer_reviews.text: My initial review was a 5-star one but I feel compelled to change this now. After using this religiously for 6 months the stroller is now unable to be folded up, which defeats the entire purpose of having it to be compact in the car. I have been unable to reach customer service because they have limited hours and I am always on hold for more than 30 minutes. We are seeking other options for a replacement one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Be better without middle wheels
customer_reviews.text: Great, except when turning around, middle wheels tend to get stuck a little too often. This design would have been better without the middle wheels. It’s quite annoying to have to push more then once to get the stroller going because it gets jammed and is hard to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Bou

customer_reviews.title: WONDERFUL!!
customer_reviews.text: Best money I've ever spent! My son and grandson are 2 years apart. One is 3 and the other is 1. Taking them both somewhere (like to softball practice, games, church, the mall, anywhere) is a chore. I can't carry them both, and they both want to run off. This high chair fits them both perfectly. I love the pockets on the back. I love the little sun shades. I love the drink carrier for my drink. I hook out bags over the handles. It's easy to push!
customer_reviews.author: Lala

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I have had this stroller for a year. My kids are now 2 and 3. It’s pretty wide but no wider than a wheelchair so it fits through doors (it’s a snug fit). There are four storage compartments but a diaper bag hook would be nice since there is nothing that size. I’d recommend it for quick trips but the style of seat shouldn’t be used for an all day trip.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Ok for now
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been looking for light weighted stroller for months and finally got this one. It’s durable and cheap, but the handle is too short even for me, a 5’2 tall mom. I’m still thinking to replace it with other brands. Parents know that how important to protect your back and waist from pushing/holding babies.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: great stroller for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice double stroller. My daughter wanted to leave one at my vacation home so she didn't have to lug her big double stroller every time she came. Works really well. It is sturdy and functional. I will say I agree with the other comments on the handles could be longer. I am a 5'9 grandma and feel like I have to slightly hunch over when pushing the grandkids. That said - my daughter and I both liked the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: MMW

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller but a little dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It is very compact, easy to close and does not weigh a lot. The issue we had on 2 of these is that the brakes are just a little plastic piece that breaks very easily. We figured no huge deal and we will be careful. Well, one time it slipped our mind and we look up to see the stroller rolling toward the street. Last time we used it :)
customer_reviews.author: M. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Light, compact, and easy to fold. Meets my needs.
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is probably the lightest and most compact stroller you can get. All of those tandem strollers aren’t worth getting...i just bought a bigger shade with this stroller. There isn’t much storage, but that’s is ok when you have toddlers.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette

customer_reviews.title: I love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this stroller twice, not because the 1st one didn’t last.. it was just dirty from kids being kids . I have a 2 and 3 year old, they both fit in it just fine, the 3yr old is too big for the seatbelt but still can sit in the seat comfortably. The stroller is very easy to just fold up and it’s light. It fits almost everywhere. I’ve had big bulky expensive double strollers but this one is by far my favorite. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! I LOVE this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is perfect for the price! I got it for my 2 sons (3 years and 18 months), but my tiny 5 year old daughter gets rides occasionally as well. It rides nicely, pushes easily, and goes through every door I have encountered. We purchased for our trip to the beach and I think it will be perfect! The storage pouches are big enough for phones, keys, diapers, cups, wipes, etc. No need to lug around a diaper bag! I LOVE this stroller! Far better than my more expensive double stroller!!! Couldn't be happier!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paws

customer_reviews.title: Does what you need it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it isn’t bulky. It can be difficult to fold up though. I wish the sun shades were a little larger, they don’t really do much. It has a lot of on board storage which is really nice. It can be hard to maneuver, not sure if that is a design flaw or just due to it’s size? I think there are probably some designed a bit better....
customer_reviews.author: Lynnette S

customer_reviews.title: Great double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Loved this for our trip to Disney World! The only thing is the shade is very small and does not block the sun. Was very east to carry on the plane and the busses
customer_reviews.author: Jose Martinez

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time broke
customer_reviews.text: I have now bought 2 of these and definitely won’t buy another. The first time I thought it was the kids mis-using the foot straps as 1 broke. Based on the price I bought a 2nd. I was happier with the 2nd at first as it was easier to push but after only 5 months this time the strap broke again and we only used it a few times. So definitely not the kids mis-usage. Don’t waste your money as I also called Delta to see if I could just buy parts with no success. Spend a little more money and buy a better quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Weslie Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: So I’m not a big fan of umbrella strollers bc I have a long gravel road where I live and they normally don’t push well in gravel THIS IS AMAZING it works great it’s so easy and I fit my 4month old and 3&1/2 year old in it PERFECTLY it reclines so my baby can lay back and have amazing seatbelts
customer_reviews.author: Kendle Langley

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller
customer_reviews.text: I have six week old twins and this stroller works perfectly for my needs. It’s lightweight, easy to manage, and doesn’t take up much space in the trunk of my car or in my closet at home. It’s a great stroller for me twins to grow in. Not to mention, you can’t beat the price. Thanks amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great buy at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller, the ride is smooth, it is easy to turn and I even had no trouble pushing it over grass at the playground. I like that the seats can lie back a little which is rare in any umbrella type stroller. The only negatives I could find is that the shades are useless like most other umbrella strollers, and that I would have liked to have a bar across the seats. Overall a great stroller for the price that was easy to put together and fits in my front hall without being in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Best double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this stroller. It makes life with little so much easier. I love that it's easy to fold, light weight and fits through all doors. Most double strollers are none of those. It also doesn't take up a lot of room. There are mesh baskets on the back and pockets too. Also super amazing for as little as it cost.
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at first
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad double stroller, though it hasn’t held up as well as I hoped. I’ve had it about 6-7 months, using for everyday out and about like the mall, walks, etc, as well as zoo trips and things. It started off as a pretty good stroller but now the brakes have pretty much broken off and one side is suddenly very hard to fold up. It’s also not maneuvering quite as easily. Still “does the job” but I think we’ll be getting a better stroller soon since we’ll be needing it for a while longer.
customer_reviews.author: elynnk

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for airport travel
customer_reviews.text: We bought this double stroller for travel with our twins and it worked out great. The stroller is light and portable, and quickly opens/closes for quick gate check. We've also used it at home, but it doesn't ride smoothly on the road when we took the kids for a walk. It felt like my hand was vibrating while pushing the stroller, but it was just how the stroller operated outdoors vs. indoors. It's best for indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: The wheel assembly is not easy to get at first. My middle wheel came off druing first use. Going back to the drawing board, finally figuring it out & works great. Easy to fold & store. Both kids were comfortable regardless the middle wheel. I thought the handles extended but, they don't. Wish they did!
customer_reviews.author: Paulita12

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller!! It was as awesome price, too!! Materials all seem durable and it has an excellent strap. However, the straps are difficult to adjust. We bought the red one and love that it came with a pocket in the back hood. You can also open up the hood for more circulation. Has a cup holder that you can move around for whatever your needs are. I wish you could purchase additional cup holders separately.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke E.

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the best stroller I’ve purchased it drives like butter and super light. I bought it for my kids for Disney- they are 7 and 9 and much too big for a stroller but it was a complete life saver- they absolutely loved it! They are approximately 60lbs each.
customer_reviews.author: kim marten

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY IT- POOR DESIGN.
customer_reviews.text: The seats are not attached to the frame. My boys can wiggle out of the harness and stand up and walk around, with the stroller dragging behind them. Super unsafe, i needed it for daycare drop off and its not usable due to this issue. Really disapointed i bought this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great for Twins!
customer_reviews.text: As a twin mom this is a super light weight and compact stroller that I can get in and out of the car with ease. I needed a stroller I could handle by myself, and this did the job. The only con - the straps over the strollers are a little long (even when adjusted to its smallest setting) for my 9 month old twins. The width straps are able to adjust very short, so there is no issue there.
customer_reviews.author: tiffanylee

customer_reviews.title: Good but not for rough handling
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. I received one as a baby shower gift - that one broke (wheel assembly snapped) after airline travel for the holidays. I bought a second stroller and that one broke as well (tire broke off). They were both great while they lasted, I will not buy another, but if someone gifted me one, I would use it till the wheels fall off!!!
customer_reviews.author: RAIN ROD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase, simple stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Super helpful and easy to use. Have to break it in a little for collapsing - at first, it took a little effort and couldnt use my foot to kick the lever to collapse, but after using it some it is easy and can flip the levers with my foot. Great quality for the price!! I was sick of these expensive, giant, annoying to use fancy strollers and bought this! Use it often!!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Jumper

customer_reviews.title: Best stroller
customer_reviews.text: The best stroller ever! Its so easy to get assembled quickly. I was hesitant that it was going to be too wide to fit through standard doors but it fits through easily. I really like that you can recliner either side without doing it simultaneously.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan M

customer_reviews.title: Great double umbrella!! Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, easy to fold stroller. Very convenient. Very easy to fold and unfold. Hard to find good double umbrellas at an affordable price. This is one of them. It doesn’t look cheap and flimsy either! The wheels are just plastic so they’re not very smooth rolling at this point. But we’ve used it a lot. The 5-pt harness is very good quality and easy to get babies in and out of. I have 4 strollers and I use this one the most.
customer_reviews.author: barbara  e fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller!! We used this stroller for our trip to Disneyland. It was easy to fly and travel with. It folds up nicely and the wheels worked wonderfully. We used it with our 4 year old, 6 year old and 9 month old, they took turns riding when their legs were tired. It worked great for each of them. The seats recline a little so our baby could sleep if he wanted. The sun shades don’t shade all that much but the boys were covered enough and could see well.
customer_reviews.author: Sped Teacher

customer_reviews.title: My kids are comfortable and that works for me.
customer_reviews.text: My kids are very comfortable and do not complain in this stroller. My children are shorter and skinnier so they will probably fit in this stroller for a while. My daughter is 5 and my son is 3. I thought she was going to grow out of it quickly, but she still has at least another year in it. I like the idea of having them in a stroller at amusement parks. This stroller is made very well and it is very sturdy. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Murray

customer_reviews.title: Short but good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Smooth rolling, easy to fold, and compact. Cons: Short! I’m 5’5 and it’s fine but much taller and it would be an awkward height. The cup holder isn’t as steady so heavy cups don’t stay put. The buckles around the hips are easy to clip in (standard safety clip like in a shopping cart) but the straps that go over the shoulders clip onto the hip buckle aren’t the same kind and are difficult to get on quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Martin

customer_reviews.title: Happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this stroller because I needed a smaller double stroller to fit my cars trunk better. I only use strollers for the mall and mainly the Disney parks/universal parks. I was nervous since my previous double stroller was great with storage & the kids fit perfectly. Well, I am a happy client. This stroller works perfect for my needs. It has pockets in the back of each seat for bottles or snacks and my bookbag straps just fine on the handles. Plus the kids fit very well. And I don’t have babies. I have a 3 year old and my 7 year old once he is tired from walking he fits perfectly in it. I would recommend this double stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Naydamar P.

customer_reviews.title: Test it out first
customer_reviews.text: I got this stroller with high hopes. Once we got it out of the box I noticed it was missing a cup holder... okay no biggie. We immediately went outside for a walk to the park. The stroller pulled in one direction constantly and I was having to correct it. The fabric was great and the storage was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Kelcste889

customer_reviews.title: The wheels feel like they're going to fall off
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this solely for the use of transporting our 11 month old twin boys in and out of daycare. It's been VERY GENTLY used the past couple of months and has not held up well. The wheels feel like they're going to fall off, the canopies do not properly cover the boys in the rain, and the handles are entirely too short for even my petite, 5'3 frame. I really wanted to love it since it was affordable and had other good reviews. However, it's lightweight frame is the only plus side in my opinion. I wish we wouldn't have gone the cheaper route by purchasing this stroller as we are now in the market for another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive option with great functionality
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for on the go with 2. I specifically selected this one for the set of wheels under the center. The shade is mostly useless and the wheel brakes are decidedly flimsy but it fits in the back of my car with no problem and through doorways without much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Wow! This is what you need.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, BUY this product. Do not overpay on another stroller. This is the finest stroller I have discovered at such a great price. I have nothing bad to say about it at all. It folds nicely, easy to maneuver, and, even though it doesn't have the net (or basket) underneath for storage, it is so worth the low price! I would suggest adding an attachable hook for a bag. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Secko

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought this 4 yrs ago instead of wasting money on those front-back strollers that are so hard to push. My kids are on the older side and I may only be able to get a year out of this, but it’s worth it. Plus, it’s lightweight and doesn’t take up too much room in my trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: Folds perfectly fits in my trunk with so much room to spare!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a smaller double stroller to make more room in my trunk and wasn't so giant this stroller is perfect! It gives me plenty of room in my trunk and I don't feel like I'm pushing around a massive force of nature even fits through basic doorways.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for a vacation where I had zero expectations on loving it, but ended up singing its praises the entire time we used it. Our 4 year old and 2 year old were able to fit in it comfortably. I wish it had more storage, but the pockets behind each seat are still pretty good sized. In all honesty, this stroller is better than I ever could have imagined.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn Huntzinger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stroller for our twin boys
customer_reviews.text: Perfect stroller for our twin boys. We had a much larger stroller previously and it was just to much for my wife to lug in and out of the car all the time. This stroller is super light and easy to fold and unfold. We use it primarily for taking the boys in and out of daycare and couldn't be happier. I would take this over an inline stroller any day.
customer_reviews.author: wvrktguy

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice, lightweight stroller
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice, lightweight stroller...however, it is very short. I am 5'10" so it would not be comfortable to push around for a long period of time for me. My husband is 6'2" so it would be especially uncomfortable for him. Also, because the handle bar does not go all the way across, it is not as easy to steer. I want to return it but I got rid of the box. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to manage traveling by myself with the kids
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed to get two toddlers safely through multiple airports. Light and easy to manage traveling by myself with the kids. Comfy handles, good storage pockets on the back. Not luxurious but it more than got the job done for $50! I couldn't maneuver the setup/weight of our CitiMini alone so this was a good alternative, and it served its purpose well. My one complaint would be that the wheels are just made of hard plastic, no rubber on them - but as long as you're indoors or on pavement it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: CBM

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have twins and this is a great stroller for an affordable price. It folds up and fits easily in the trunk leaving plenty of room for other items. The seats adjust so they can sit up or lay back more which is nice if they want to pay attention or nap.
customer_reviews.author: jordan hinkle

customer_reviews.title: Great at airport
customer_reviews.text: Perfect umbrella stroller. Took it to Mexico and didnt even use a bag to check it. Fit through all the doors. It’s not the smoothest but can’t beat the price. A lot of people have asked me where I got it since it’s not so big. Folded it it takes up the same space as a single umbrella stroller. Love this thing
customer_reviews.author: Elena Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my two kids
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my two kids, fits perfectly in my car (dodge caliper) I would not purchase this for children older than 3! My daughter is 3 2’10 and 30lbs she fits fine but not much growing room. I bought it for the going to the grocery store walks or the park. Dose fine in gravel and taller grass. Again my daughter is smaller than most 3 year olds so I wouldn’t suggest it for kids who are bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle1234

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but not really a good stroller
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as I need a lightweight stroller for traveling during the Spring break. The only good thing is it's quite light and easy to carry. But there is very little room to carry stuff. The wheels are kind of hard to control and the shade is pretty much useless. I suggest buying extra shades if you plan to use it frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Trinh

customer_reviews.title: Great and compact
customer_reviews.text: Good buy. I have twins and am constantly lugging around a huge stroller in my trunk. This one folds down so small and can fit on the floor in the back seat of my car. Doesn't fit through all doors and store isles but that's to be expected with side by side strollers. My girls seems very comfortable in it and would definitely recommend it to my twin mom friends. I did already have a prong off one of the buckles break. So it's not a super durable stroller. But it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: WRKDesigns

product_meta.title: Delta Children LX Side by Side Tandem Umbrella Stroller, Lime & Green
product_meta.description:
Color:Lime & Green11701_013 Features: -Product Type:Twin strollers -Color:Green -Distressed:No -Frame Material:Metal -Number of Items Included:1. Dimensions: -Overall Height - Top to Bottom:37.5 -Overall Width - Side to Side:29 -Overall Depth - Front to Back:30.5. Note-do not exceed the maximum storage weight limit of 3 pounds in the storage bag or canopy pouch. Do not exceed the maximum storage weight limit of 3 pounds in the cup holder. Do not place additional items on this product, except as recommended in the instructions. To clean the plastic parts on stroller use a mild cleaning solution with warm water on a sponge or damp cloth. Hand wash fabric with damp cloth and air dry. Do not use bleach

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The LX Side By Side Stroller rolls all the style and functioning that comes with the standard LX Stroller into one impressive package - for two. It's safe, practical, and handles two passengers with the style and ease of one great stroller. The need for mobility in a side by side stroller is crucial, which is why the LX version comes with a lightweight frame that fits into any standard 30" doorway, as well as 360 degree shock absorbing front wheels. It makes the handling and use of the stroller safe, easy, and even fun for any parent. The LX Side By Side is good for baby because of its multi-position reclining feature, and 5-point harness with soft shoulder pads. It's also good for mommy or daddy because of its compact umbrella fold for easy storage and travel, cup holder with two attachment points, and 2 large hanging storage bags. The large European-style canopy simply adds to the style and beauty of this fully-featured stroller. This stroller is JPMA certified, meets or exceeds all ASTM standards, and conforms to all CPSC standards. Recommended for use up to 35 pounds in each seat, the LX Side By Side makes taking two for a stroll as easy, safe, and functional as taking just one.
feature_bullets: Recommend for children up to 35 pounds. Large European style canopy. Two storage bags and parent cup holder with two attachment points. Meets Disney size requirements
Compact umbrella fold for easy storage and travel, 5 point harness with soft shoulder pads
Parent cup holder, 2 large hanging storage bag
360 Degree shock absorbing front wheels, large European style canopy

Fits through a Standard 30 Inches Door, JPMA Certified, meets or exceeds all ASTM standards, conforms to all applicable CPSC standards. DO NOT exceed the maximum storage weight limit of 3 pounds in the cup holder
This item is eligible for free replacement parts. Contact Amazon Customer Service for more information
